tweets.author: pumpdotfun

tweets.content:
if you know someone that wants to stream on pump fun, it's your duty to the trenches to guide them the right way

that way we avoid horror stories and maximise the odds of SUCCESS stories. better for you, better for them, better for the entire space

make sure they

- get enough supply for the long-term and commit to holding the token for at least a few months
- be completely transparent about their plans for the future. no overpromising!
- commit to gaining the trust of the community. don't mess with people's money and play by the rules
- keep their plans to launch a coin lowkey. if many people know about the launch in advance, it leaves room for sniping which could ruin the coin performance and hurt early traders
- ideally have a streaming schedule thought out in advance. Consistency matters

if they're a large creator and require further support, feel free to reach out to me or anyone else with a pump fun affiliate badge. we're overrun with requests at the moment so we will try to assist as many cases as we can!

tweets.content:
The creator economy has long run on a model where views drive ad revenue.

Chasing views forces creators onto a treadmillâ€¦ churning out endless content, dumbing it down, and chasing algorithms.

And they still donâ€™t own their audience.

The way forward is to monetise depth, not just reach. Building deeper connections with your community should be a real alternative â€” @pumpdotfunâ€™s latest product improvements make this possible.

Check it out and leave a review here
tweets.author: pumpdotfun

tweets.content:
this is a highly innovative approach for the space

for the first time creators can be meaningfully rewarded for their dedication and consistent effort

this model empowers creators and CTOs to fund essential activities such as marketing, content creation, listings, and whatever

smart strategic decision that will inspire builders to create truly impactful coins, and rewarding the LONG term builders, finally.

big win for the ecosystem man @pumpdotfun
tweets.author: pumpdotfun

tweets.author: pumpdotfun

tweets.content:
Huge update and honestly a step in the right direction. 

The impact the fees have had for certain projects has been huge and incentivizes people to work that much harder and most importantly STICK AROUND.

we are able to pay artist, pay marketing, donate to causes, and so much more.

Huge win for those who truly care about making their project be great and last.

W @pumpdotfun 

I will add one thing, i think we need to find a solution for non pumpswap og pumpfun coins that dont get fees.

Should find a way to show love to those communities who are still working hard.
tweets.author: pumpdotfun

tweets.content:
this is probably the best thing small projects couldâ€™ve asked for

projects with less exposure grinding it out get a higher % of trading fees - almost like an incubation period prior to becoming a household meme

we may start to see more explosive microcaps, which is exactly what we wanna see
tweets.author: pumpdotfun

tweets.content:
TLDR: The game will CHANGE FOREVER

There has been a huge problem since day 1 with CTOs. How can people stay motivated to grind without having to worry about getting the necessary funding for listings? Funding for content? 

Take this as an example: you have @grizzle_art grinding for a CTO of her own art since day one.

If she had collected the fees since day 1 or 2 of the CTO, she would have earned $1 Million, which she could have used for expenses, or even to get listings

@rasmr_eth is literally out there in the road every single day streaming, imagine earning $100k in such a short amount of time

What's also important here, is that these fees DO NOT hurt whales, it's a tiered system -> making it easier for whales to size in higher market caps

This is probably the most bullish release of 2025 and it's finally good to see that teams can focus on actually working on their coins

@pumpdotfun supercycle

tweets.author: pumpdotfun

tweets.content:
the solution: Dynamic Fees V1

Dynamic Fees V1 is a brand new tiered Creator Fee structure exclusive to PumpSwap, designed specifically for acceleration & longevity

Creator Fees are tiered by market cap, meaning that the higher the market cap of the coin, the lower the Creator Fee

this fee structure applies to ALL PumpSwap coins, whether new or old, meaning existing creators & communities can bootstrap themselves for massive growth

the fee rates earned by the pump fun protocol & autocompounding fees to liquidity providers (including the burned LPs) are exactly the same as before.

for the full fee structure breakdown, go to pump[.]fun/docs/fees
tweets.author: pumpdotfun

tweets.content:
the problem: running a startup, viral marketing campaigns, exchange listings, etc. are expensive

the current Creator Fees donâ€™t move the needle

however, raising fees across the board comes at the direct expense of traders and can hurt the coin's ability to grow long-term
tweets.author: pumpdotfun

i think i witnessed a miracle today

i decided to touch grass for the first time in a while. going out into the real world was scary, but it felt refreshing

although, i couldn't help but feel like someone was watching me. after a few minutes, i caved in. i shouted "who's there?!"

then, and only then, did he reveal himself - i was looking at God himself. he told me that my targets are not nearly high enough and i should stop being a pussy

i don't know whether to laugh or cry, but all i know is that we're divinely protected and the parabola is on its way.
